page.title: 10R.A.F.Catterick
page.content: Soon after the founding of the{R.A.F. {Regiment}in the early 1940s R.A.F. Catterick was designated as the Regimental Depot and has continued this role ever since. The Regiment was started primarily to defend R.A.F. bases throughout the world.The courses that are run at R.A.F.Catterick are very much concerned with this work,and include fighting fires on aircraft. Old planes are brought in and set on fire to create true conditions for this hazardous training. It is also possible to see personnel receiving training in parachuting and gunnery. One of about five{R.A.F.Bands}is based here and does much effective work in the area through schools and local concerts. The Station is commanded by a Group Captain and provides work for many local people.
